transcript: In Kiev Pierre found some people he knew, and strangers hastened to make his acquaint- ance and joyfully welcomed the rich newcomer, the largest landowner of the province. Temp- tations to Pierre's greatest weakness the one to which he had confessed when admitted to the Lodge were so strong that he could not re- sist them. Again whole days, weeks, and months of his life passed in as great a rush and were as much occupied with evening parties, dinners, lunches, and balls, giving him no t
